text:
My heart just breaks into pieces knowing that there are no real or true changes that have taken place.  Our youths have sacrificed tremendously. I understand that change is gradual, that change comes with sacrifices.......
I pray that our youths' courage and sacrifice is not in vain. Aluta continua‚úäüèø

author: @kmejor9916

text: I think we have a crisis of activism in Kenya and i keep saying you cant demonstrate yourself to prosperity. Government is not your daddy and is very poor in actually providing solutions because Government policy will always be tainted by petty politics and ridiculous ideology . As GenZ and Young people we have to be the generation that provides solutions. The next Equity, EABL, Safaricom are not going to be built by government, activists, or protestors but our own hard work. We need to be at the forefront of drafting policy and frameworks that enables us thrive, not react to whatever government comes up with. For example we need to lobby for funding of direct capital to startups, small businesses and cottage industries from development partners instead of the funds going to  government for grand infrastructure projects. Bottomline, there is no Messiah, Miracle leader or Government that will solve all our problems as the activists will have you believe.
